intro: Hibbertia lividula, commonly known as the silver-leafed hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its slender, woody stems and distinctive silver-green foliage. The plant produces showy yellow flowers with prominent red stamens, typically blooming in spring. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils in open habitats. Hibbertia lividula is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
